content.question: A man is seated on a chair while holding out a weight in each hand. The chair has a seat that can rotate with virtually no friction. Initially, the man sits in the position shown. The man begins to slowly spin, and then pulls his hands inward. Which of the following is a correct claim about the manâ€™s motion as he pulls his hands inward and the correct justification for this claim?

choices.label: He will spin faster and faster due to conservation of energy.
He will spin faster and faster due to conservation of angular momentum.
He will spin faster and faster due to conservation of linear momentum.
He will slow down and come to rest due to conservation of angular momentum.
He will slow down and come to rest due to conservation of mechanical energy.

content.answer: He will spin faster and faster due to conservation of angular momentum.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
